data.title: WAY STATION by Clifford D Simak Read by Eric Michael Summerer Mike Resnick
data.meta_description: Enoch Wallace is not buried in the grave that bears his name. Instead, Enoch, a Civil War veteran, has been entrusted by an alien to be the caretaker
data.text: Enoch Wallace is not buried in the grave that bears his name. Instead, Enoch, a Civil War veteran, has been entrusted by an alien to be the caretaker for a secret Way Station, which makes Earth a stop on an interstellar travel route. He experiences a life like no other human, meeting and interacting with aliens from all over the galaxy while the rest of humanity remains in ignorance. Eric Michael Summerer performs this classic Hugo Award-winning novel from 1963 in a straightforward and enjoyable fashion. Always welcome is a thoughtful introduction, for this book written and read by author Mike Resnick. A true classic, perfectly presented. S.D.D.
